definition: to have rotten luck (stronger version of 倒霉[dao3 mei2])
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to have bad luck/to be out of luck
to infuriate/to be furious/to die from an excess of anger
lit. to try to steal a chicken only to end up losing the rice used to lure it (idiom)/fig. to try to gain an advantage only to end up worse off/to go for wool and come back shorn
pinyin: tou1 ji1 bu4 cheng2 shi2 ba3 mi3

definition: (lit.) to get shot even when lying down/(fig.) to get unjustly ridiculed, attacked, implicated in sth etc while just being present (Internet slang)/abbr. to 躺槍|躺枪[tang3 qiang1]
messenger of death (cf Irish banshee)/person bringing bad luck
see 他媽的|他妈的[ta1 ma1 de5]
bearer of ill luck/person with the evil eye/comet
